other_tests.findings: Psoriasiform epidermal hyperplasia with parakeratosis and a mixed inflammatory infiltrate in the superficial dermis, features suggestive of a hypersensitivity reaction.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Skin-biopsy specimens obtained later showed eczema-tous and interface dermatitis, dyskeratotic cells, and a mixed inflammatory infiltrate.

other_tests.findings: Cytologic examination revealed small lymphoid cells. Flow cytometry showed no evidence of an abnormal lymphocyte population.
On initial examination, very few SÃ©zary cells were noted; subsequent analysis showed CD4 T cells with a CD4:CD8 ratio of approximately 10.
other_tests.changes_over_time: On later examination, flow cytometric analysis of peripheral blood revealed a CD4:CD8 ratio of 9, and additional abnormalities were detected over time.

other_tests.findings: Hypercellular marrow with increased eosinophils and an atypical lympho-histiocytic infiltrate consistent with T-cell lymphoma.
other_tests.changes_over_time: The same T-cell clone was found in both the bone marrow and blood.

other_tests.findings: After three cycles, erythroderma and pruritus improved, and the CD4:CD8 ratio decreased to 2.6.
other_tests.changes_over_time: After the fourth cycle, discrete annular plaques developed on the trunk and arms.
